column1: #Text=Dozens killed in Congo plane crash , transport minister fired
#Text=More than 50 people have been killed after a plane crashed in the Democratic Republic of the Congo , causing president Joseph Kabila to fire his transport minister .
#Text=The Russian -built Antonov An-26 twin- turboprop cargo plane went down into a market in the African nation 's capital , Kinshasa , killing 51 and injuring at least 25 , mostly on the ground .
#Text=Of the plane 's crew , only the Congolese flight engineer survived the accident .
#Text=The Congolese air safety record is one of the worst in the world , and this is the latest and deadliest in a string of recent aviation accidents and incidents .
#Text=According to presidential spokesman Kudura Kasongo , the reason behind the sacking of transport minister Remy Henri Kuseyo Gatanga is " for being incapable of organising the aviation sector " .

#Text=Transport Minister Rémy Kuseyo had previously said the aircraft should never have taken off due to a ban imposed three weeks ago on the use of Antonov aircraft in the country due to safety concerns .
#Text=He feels his dismissal is unjust , saying " Measures had been taken ...

#Text=The crash has provoked national outrage , with local newspapers using headlines such as  Another flying coffin kills again , " and " Congo 's killer skies , " .

column1: #Text=The government had promised to improve poor safety standards .
#Text=The plane belonged to Africa One , but had been leased to Manilla Airlift .
#Text=The aircraft had undergone a safety inspection prior to it 's departure from nearby Ndjili international airport .

#Text=The International Air Transport Association has described Congo 's aviation safety record as ' an embarrassment ' , while all Congolese airlines except Hewa Bora Airways are on the List of air carriers banned in the EU .
